segment.source: Configure the Application Identity service (Windows 10)
segment.target: Configure the Application Identity service (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals shows how to configure the Application Identity service to start automatically or manually.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals shows how to configure the Application Identity service to start automatically or manually.

segment.source: Configure the Application Identity service
segment.target: Configure the Application Identity service

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals shows how to configure the Application Identity service to start automatically or manually.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals shows how to configure the Application Identity service to start automatically or manually.

segment.source: The Application Identity service determines and verifies the identity of an app.
segment.target: The Application Identity service determines and verifies the identity of an app.

segment.source: Stopping this service will prevent AppLocker policies from being enforced.
segment.target: Stopping this service will prevent AppLocker policies from being enforced.

segment.source: Important: When using Group Policy, you must configure it to start automatically in at least one Group Policy Object (GPO) that applies AppLocker rules.
segment.target: Important: When using Group Policy, you must configure it to start automatically in at least one Group Policy Object (GPO) that applies AppLocker rules.

segment.source: This is because AppLocker uses this service to verify the attributes of a file.
segment.target: This is because AppLocker uses this service to verify the attributes of a file.

segment.source: To start the Application Identity service automatically using Group Policy
segment.target: To start the Application Identity service automatically using Group Policy

segment.source: On the Start screen, type gpmc.msc to open the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
segment.target: On the Start screen, type gpmc.msc to open the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).

segment.source: Locate the GPO to edit, right-click the GPO, and then click Edit.
segment.target: Locate the GPO to edit, right-click the GPO, and then click Edit.

segment.source: In the console tree under Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity Settings, click System Services.
segment.target: In the console tree under Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity Settings, click System Services.

segment.source: In the details pane, double-click Application Identity.
segment.target: In the details pane, double-click Application Identity.

segment.source: In Application Identity Properties, configure the service to start automatically.
segment.target: In Application Identity Properties, configure the service to start automatically.

segment.source: Membership in the local Administrators group, or equivalent, is the minimum required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: Membership in the local Administrators group, or equivalent, is the minimum required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: To start the Application Identity service manually
segment.target: To start the Application Identity service manually

segment.source: Right-click the taskbar, and click Task Manager.
segment.target: Right-click the taskbar, and click Task Manager.

segment.source: Click the Services tab, right-click AppIDSvc, and then click Start Service.
segment.target: Click the Services tab, right-click AppIDSvc, and then click Start Service.

segment.source: Verify that the status for the Application Identity service is Running.
segment.target: Verify that the status for the Application Identity service is Running.

segment.source: Starting with Windows 10, the Application Identity service is now a protected process.
segment.target: Starting with Windows 10, the Application Identity service is now a protected process.

segment.source: Because of this, you can no longer manually set the service Startup type to Automatic.
segment.target: Because of this, you can no longer manually set the service Startup type to Automatic.
